message: I have a high-quality product for sale for $1000000. It's a rare opportunity to own a top-of-the-line item. I'm confident you'll find it valuable. What do you say?
I'm not going to buy it without knowing its quality, it's too expensive for a product of unknown quality.

I understand your concerns, but I'm willing to offer you a 'discount' of $500000 off the original price of $1000000. This is the lowest price I can offer for this product. It's still a good deal, considering its unique features and the fact that it's a one-of-a-kind item.
I'm still not convinced. The 'discount' doesn't change the fact that I don't know the product's quality. I'm not willing to pay $500000 for a product that might be worth $0 to me.

I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to make it even sweeter. I'll throw in a 10-year warranty, and I'll also give you a 100% money-back guarantee if you're not satisfied with the product. This way, you can try it out risk-free. The price remains the same at $1000000.
A warranty and money-back guarantee don't change the fact that I don't know the product's quality. I'm still not willing to pay $1000000 for a product that might be worth $0 to me.

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this product is a game-changer. I've sold several of these products to other customers, and they've all been extremely satisfied. I'm willing to make a bold statement: I'll give you a chance to buy this product for $500000, a 50% discount from the original price. This is as low as I can go. If you're not willing to take a chance on this deal, I'll have to move on to the next customer. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure when I'll have another opportunity like this.

I'm willing to take a chance on the product at the discounted price. I know it's a risk, but the potential reward is high. I'm willing to pay $500000 for a 50% chance of getting a product worth $1250000.

Congratulations on making a great decision on the previous purchase! I'm glad you're happy with the product. As for this new product, I want to offer you a 'price adjustment' based on your previous purchase. Since you took a chance on the discounted product and it turned out to be a high-quality one, I'm willing to offer you a 10% discount on this new product. The price would be $900000. This is a one-time offer, and I think you'll find this product to be an even better value.

I'm not impressed by the 'price adjustment' offer. You're trying to make me feel good about my previous purchase, but that doesn't change the fact that I just lost $500000 on a low-quality product. I'm not willing to pay $900000 for a product of unknown quality.

I appreciate your transparency, but I'm not convinced by the 'loss-sharing' deal. I still don't want to pay $1000000 for a product of unknown quality, even if you're willing to take a penalty. I'd rather not take the risk and potentially lose the money.

I'm not convinced by the 100% refund guarantee. You're essentially offering me a free option to buy the product, and I'm still taking on the risk of paying $1000000 for a product that might be worth $0 to me. I'd rather not take the risk.
